name: Sheraton Salt Lake City Hotel

reviews.text: The hotel was nice on the inside, but the outside is long overdue for an update. I stayed at the Radison on a previous visit and I prefer that hotel and location. Staff was very helpful. $10 charge for in-room wifi (free in the lobby). Free shuttle to and from the airport and they will hold your bags before or after check-in/out. The shuttle will take you to areas near the hotel, but you may have to wait awhile, because the airport shuttle is the priority. The train is approx 1 block from the hotel. There is a restaurant and bar in the lobby. Free bottle of water in your room. Outdoor pool.
reviews.title: Good but not great

reviews.text: The staff have all been friendly and very helpful. I'm here for a conference and those facilities are very good. The pool is nice. The hotels rooms seem to be a crap-shoot. Mine, on the Starwood preferred member level, had a burnt out bathroom light (got fixed), has a broken towel rack, has no lounge chair or ottoman like you see in all the photos on the website, and has a broken curtain rod. I've heard troubling stories from my colleagues about their rooms as well. Parts of the room feel like other Sheraton rooms I've stayed in, other parts feel like a Motel 6. The wifi in the room ($9.95/day extra) is also very slow. We had a dinner for 200 tonight and it was just plain bad. The beef was dry and tough as were the potatoes. The chocolate desert resembled something from Hostess, but dry as well. The wait staff did a wonderful job. I'd like to like this place better because the conference is going well but sadly, I just can't.
reviews.title: The good and the not so good.

reviews.text: My wife and I recently stayed at the Sheraton Salt Lake City for two nights. This was a celebration of our 20th wedding anniversary, and we had high expectations for our very short stay. Our room was upgraded to a Junior Suite on arrival and it was delightful. We were comfortable and enjoyed the space it allowed us. The staff on duty the night of 7/8 was engaging and very congratulatory of our 20th anniversary.
reviews.title: Solid but average for Sheraton

reviews.text: We spent time by the pool. The towels were plentiful, the lawn service associates were cautious to avoid making too much noise in our area, shade was plentiful and we had a relaxing day.

reviews.text: My wife, mother and I stayed for two nights while exploring SLC. nice lobby. The swimming pool is huge and goes to 8 feet deep. My mother forgot to take her hearing aid out before going in the water and it shorted out. At 11:15 at nite, we were looking for raw rice, to hopefully draw the moisture out. The concierge and bartender were very nice to my mother and got her rice. My mother had some technology issues ( she is 84 years old) everyone she asked for help was able to help her. I am headed to the 24 hour fitness center.
reviews.title: Two nights great!

reviews.text: Room was clean, check in and out efficient. Great water pressure in the bathrooms. Outdoor pool and indoor hot tub and sauna. Never used these but walked down and they looked nice. It is an older hotel but is on par with others in SLC.
reviews.title: Solid Sheraton

reviews.title: Solid Sheraton

reviews.text: Calibration disclaimer: this is a good Sheraton and this ranking is for that and similar-type hotels; it is not a an objective ranking against all hotels. I stayed for one night in May with a dog. The hotel has been renovated with the new Sheraton livery / theme in the past few years and is generally bright and comfortable despite the fact the the building itself is a little dark and feels a bit old. The hotel has a main tower with multiple floors and a courtyard with two stories of rooms around it. I got a suite with a view on the courtyard and didn't spend too much time in it. All fittings and fixtures worked well, the room service was fine, and the bed was comfortable. It's five or six blocks to the most interesting parts of downtown, which on a good day in Salt Lake City is a pleasant walk. Caffeine addicts will be happy to know there is a full Starbucks in the lobby. All told, this hotel is fine and fits most needs, although I thought the rooms rate was a bit inflated for a Sheraton.
reviews.title: Close to Downtown and Light Rail Line
